description: Known for their large, bright yellow blooms resembling the sun.
meaning: Sunflowers symbolize adoration, loyalty and longevity. Much of the meaning of sunflowers stems from its namesake, the sun itself. These flowers are unique in that they have the ability to provide energy in the form of nourishment and vibrancy—attributes which mirror the sun and the energy provided by its heat and light.

description: Roses come in a variety of colors, known for their beauty and fragrance.
meaning: Roses are most commonly associated with love and romance. Roses can also mean secrecy or confidentiality. The term “sub rosa” means under the rose and comes from the practice of Romans hanging roses above meeting tables. Here the rose symbolized the confidentiality of the debate.

description: Tulips are elegant flowers with cup-shaped blooms. They come in various colors and represent perfect love and springtime.
meaning: Tulips commonly mean perfect or deep love. As different colors of tulips can have different meanings, red tulips are most strongly associated with true love. The meaning of yellow tulips has evolved somewhat, from once representing hopeless love to now being a common expression for cheerful thoughts and sunshine.

description: Prized for fragrant purple flowers and aromatic foliage.
meaning: Lavender flowers are known to represent purity, silence, devotion serenity, grace and calmness. In addition to the flower’s significance, its purple color also comes with great symbolism. Purple is the color of royalty and speaks of elegance, refinement and luxury.

description: Simple yet charming flowers with white petals and yellow centers.
meaning: Daisies symbolize innocence and purity. This stems from an old Celtic legend. According to the legend, whenever an infant died, God sprinkled daisies over the earth to cheer the parents up.

description: Large, trumpet-shaped flowers in a variety of colors.
meaning: Hibiscus flowers are known to represent delicate beauty, unity and peace. The hibiscus flower holds special meaning in many Asian countries and is also the national flower of Malaysia. In these countries, the flower is used in important ceremonies and is considered a symbol of peace and happiness.

description: Sacred flower in many Asian cultures, known for its beauty and purity.
meaning: The lotus flower represents purity and divine beauty. The unfolding flower embodies the endless ocean of creation. The lotus flower is often associated with purity, rebirth and divinity. It is also a symbol of beauty, prosperity, and fertility.

description: Pink or white flowers that bloom in spring.
meaning: Cherry blossoms are a symbolic flower of the spring, a time of renewal, and the fleeting nature of life. Their life is very short. After their beauty peaks around two weeks, the blossoms start to fall. During this season in Japan, people like to have cherry blossom parties with colleagues, friends, and family.

description: Lush and fragrant flowers with delicate, layered petals.
meaning: Peonies are known as the flower of riches and honor. With their lush, full, rounded bloom, peonies embody romance and prosperity and are regarded as an omen of good fortune and a happy marriage.
